author: Special Correspondent
text:
A Protection of Children from Sexual Offences court on Monday sentenced a man to death for sexually assaulting and killing a four-and-a-half-year-old girl in 2012. Nazir Khan, a 22-year-old worker, has been convicted of rape, murder, and disposing of the body.

On January 1, 2012, the girl went missing from her residence at Saki Naka, but the family did not immediately lodge a missing complaint with the police. Next day, the police informed the father about a body found in Vile Parle, which he identified as his daughter. The post-mortem report did not mention either the cause of death or whether there was any sexual assault. The girl’s father soon learnt that it was Khan, who worked in an industrial shed near his house, had lured his daughter to the shed.
title: Man sentenced to death for rape of 4-year-old, murder
